p: The leaf oil of Psidium rufum from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, composed primarily by E-caryophyllene (21.0%), α-pinene (14.0%), γ-eudesmol (8.5%), 1,8-cineole (8.4%), α-eudesmol (8.2%), and β-eudesmol (6.8%), showed 70% reduction (at 100 mg/kg) in eosinophil migration in Zymosan assay, and 51% reduction (at 100 mg/kg) in nitric oxide production, in vitro [ 104].
